items.description: Rivers Duddon, Crake and Mill Beck

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Duddon, River Crake, Mill Beck

items.message:
River levels are forecast to rise on the Rivers Duddon, Crake and Mill Beck due to rainfall overnight on Monday 1/8/2022. 
Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Rivers Duddon, Crake and Mill Beck and other watercourses, from Coniston to Barrow-in-Furness including low lying areas around Ulpha, Duddon Bridge, Broughton in Furness, Kirkby-in-Furness, Dalton in Furness and Ulverston from 08:00 AM on 02/08/2022.
Further rainfall is forecast tomorrow morning, but it is expected to decrease as the day goes on, River levels are expected to begin falling again on Tuesday 2/8/2022, and we do not expect any flooding to properties.
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and are checking rivers for blockages in the area.
Monitor local water levels and weather conditions. Consider putting your flood plan into action. You should avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.
This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 02/08/2022, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Brathay, River Rothay, River Winster

items.message:
River levels are forecast to rise on the Rivers Brathay, Rothay and Winster due to rainfall overnight on Monday 1/8/22 and into Tuesday morning. 
Flooding may affect low lying land and roads these rivers and their tributaries during the early hours of Tuesday and so we are warning the public to be careful if they do not know the area well.
There is little further rainfall forecast during Tuesday, and the situation should improve, however there may be standing water seen for several hours.
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and are checking rivers for blockages in the area.
Plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded, and do not walk or cycle through floods.
This message will be updated tomorrow morning 02/08/2022, or as the situation changes.
